      • receiveParsed

        public java.lang.String[] receiveParsed()
                                 throws CommException
        Receives a line and returns an array with one word in each cell
        Returns:
        an array with one word in each cell
        Throws:
        CommException - in case an error occurs while reading the data

      • receiveParsedSpecific

        public java.lang.String[] receiveParsedSpecific(java.lang.String format)
                                         throws CommException,
                                                ProtocolException
        Receives a line and returns an array containing words in the line. How many words are in each cell is dependent on the format string. A format string of "1 1 2 0" will return an array with 1 word in the first and second cells, 2 words in the third cell, and the rest of the words in the fourth cell
        Parameters:
        format - format specification for the strings
        Returns:
        the array containing the string in the specified format
        Throws:
        CommException - in case an error occurs while reading the data
        ProtocolException - in case the format is wrong

      • parseSpecific

        protected java.lang.String[] parseSpecific(java.lang.String s,
                                           java.lang.String format)
        Parses the String dividing it in single characters and following a specific format
        Parameters:
        s - String to be parsed
        format - format specification for the strings
        Returns:
        an array with the number words specified by the format in each cell

      • parse

        protected java.lang.String[] parse(java.lang.String s)
        Parses the String dividing it in single characters
        Parameters:
        s - String to be parsed
        Returns:
        an array with one character in each cell
